intro: Orthaea paruensis, commonly known as the Paruensis orthaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Orthaea paruensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
